content.question: In a certain factory, assume that the number of workers is constant. The number of minutes <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>N</mi></mstyle></math> that it takes to make a single unit of a product and the number of units <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the product that are made per day satisfy the relationship <math alttext="U equals, the fraction k over N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a constant. Which of the following best describes the relationship between the rate of change, with respect to time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, of <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and the rate of change, with respect to time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, of <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of U, with respect to t, equals, the fraction with numerator k, and denominator the derivative of N, with respect to t, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of U, with respect to t, equals, the fraction with numerator negative k, and denominator the derivative of N, with respect to t, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of U, with respect to t, equals, the fraction k over N squared, end fraction, times the derivative of N, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of U, with respect to t, equals, the fraction negative k over N squared, end fraction, times the derivative of N, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of U, with respect to t, equals, the fraction negative k over N squared, end fraction, times the derivative of N, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>N</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
